review: I looked into some of the other streaming devices but none of them were as highly praised as the Amazon Fire TV. From professionals to just-plain-folks, it received a big thumbs up. I think it was PC magazine that called it the best of the lot. I had the necessary cables, so when the device arrived I had it up and running in minutes. Wow! The picture quality is outstanding. I have my own sound system, so I ran an optical digital cable from the Amazon into my AV receiver. It's only stereo, unfortunately, but it's clear and dynamic. The remote is tiny but easy to use. Depending upon which streaming service you have, it offers voice control. I don't have it so I can't comment on it. If you have a DSL service you should be able to use their wireless router. This will save you from having to buy one. Copy the numbers that are on the side of the router. During the set-up procedure you'll be asked for your system's code. Enter the numbers you copied. It's as simple as that. The only troubling thing about the Amazon Fire TV is that you can't shut it off. It's supposed to shut itself off in 30 minutes after you stop using it, but mine remained on for two hours. Not a big problem, however. Anyway, if you're in the market for a streaming device this is the one you want. Easy to set up, easy to use.
